page.title: 08E.Horsley S. Church 2.
page.content: St Mary's Anglican Church was founded in 1030, some of the original building fabric still remaining. It has been added to over the centuries, including 3 bells in the tower. The church is eligible for a percentage grant from "English Heritage" for repairs, the most urgent of these being the spire. Commemorative thimbles are on sale as souvenirs for fund raising & parish- ioners are organising an Auction for this appeal. Local drama society 'The Whips' presented T.S. Eliot's play 'Murder in the Cathedral' this year in the church. New kneelers with designs featuring items from church history are being embroidered by parishioners. The parish magazine is published each month giving times of church services, details of parish activities, with ad- vertising by local businesses paying for the cost of production.
